intro: Crotalaria purshii var. bracteolifera, commonly known as the bracteolifera crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family, characterized by its pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with upright stems and trifoliate leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow with a distinctive black or purple pattern on the petals, and it produces small, hairy pods that contain several seeds. This species is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
